summary:
Christoph is an Engineering Manager at IKEA, leading the Family Commercial Platform team and driving the global furniture retailer's digital transformation and sustainability initiatives. He has over nine years of experience in software development, architecture, and consulting across various domains and industries.

Previously, he was a Director of Software Engineering at adidas, where he was responsible for the technical leadership and strategy for the Circular Services product area, such as the Made To Be Remade program that enables consumers to return their products for recycling and reuse. He also worked as an Associate Tech Architect at McKinsey & Company, where he helped global financial institutions adopt agile and DevOps practices. He is a Certified Scrum Master and has expertise in web and mobile development, cloud computing, and data analytics. He is passionate about creating innovative and sustainable solutions that positively impact the world.

profile_positions.description:
Christoph is currently serving as an Engineering Manager at IKEA, where he is leading the charge in developing an innovative, customer-centric platform that reimagines the Life@Home experience. He embodies the energy and agility of a startup founder, infusing these qualities into a renowned global retail operation.

Working in close collaboration with the New Business and Innovation team, Christoph is instrumental in shaping an exciting new shopping paradigm for IKEA. His collaboration with the Enterprise Architecture team is key to aligning the foundation and principles of the platform architecture

In his role, Christoph acts as a crucial link, coupling the creative visions of business designers with the technological expertise needed to produce impactful customer value propositions.
profile_positions.title: Engineering Manager

profile_positions.description: Mentoring and doing homework reviews for the HackYourFuture class "Using APIs"
profile_positions.title: Mentor | Volunteer

profile_positions.description:
Christoph has helped launch Made To be Remade, adidas venture into a circular business model where consumers can purchase, wear and send back there articles for a reward. This experience has been rolled out to +20 countries across EMEA, NAM and LAM. A major challenge has been to setup product and recycling attributes in several different systems and domains, from product creation over to reverse logistics.

He has taken on additional responsibilities by leading the Mobile Hype & Digital Retail backend development chapter interim during the paternal leave of a colleague. As a first step he has reorganized the ways of working and introduced quality standards and technical refactorings to ensure the micro-services are ready for the holiday season (singles day, black friday, cyber monday, etc.)
profile_positions.title: Director Software Engineering | Circular Services

profile_positions.description:
• Christoph is working with our integrative colleagues to develop solutions for our clients to enhance their Agile Ways of Working further and empower their software development teams to adopt DevSecOps practices to be self-sufficient and end-to-end responsible.

• He has helped our clients productizing their internal services so that other teams and services can consume them in a self-service manner. For example, together with the client's transformation office, he coached 30+ teams. He highlighted how streamlining their ordering and fulfilment process can reduce the customer's waiting time and give them more time for feature development.

• As part of the DevSecOps Hackathon Team at McKinsey, he develops hands-on training that introduces our consultants to a modern software development lifecycle. Part of the training includes using Azure DevOps to build, test and deploy a modern web application to the Azure public cloud. Hundreds of colleagues have participated in the hackathon over the past six months.
profile_positions.title: Associate Tech Architect

profile_positions.description:
Helping our clients to grow and succeed with a special focus on e-commerce. I specialize in improving our client relationship and help improve the communication between our teams. Being embedded in our on-site teams helps me to identify the challenges we are trying to solve together with our clients.

Topics include:
- Recruitment, resourcing and staffing
- New client acquisition and case studies
- Facilitating knowledge sharing session with our partners
- Identifying business opportunities and improvements
- Being a technical aid for our management and sales team
profile_positions.title: Consulting Director

profile_positions.description:
Building a new e-commerce platform for one of the largest sports brand in the world. By using modern web technologies we are producing one of the fastest online shopping experiences. We are helping our client to smoothly sail through Black Friday and Cyber Monday.

 Over the past 18 months we reduced page loads time by 66% and we rolled out the platform to +40 markets and across two brands. We helped our client to bring release cycles down from 6 weeks to at least once a day. We built a tech foundation which is used by over 80 engineers in multiple teams, ranging from product discovery, campaign pages and checkout.
profile_positions.title: Senior Software Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Christoph has been working on the Bundesliga soccer apps for Borussia Dortmund (BVB) and Hamburger Sportverein (HSV). During his time at Evenly, the HSV app was completely redesigned and the underlying architecture has been reworked. After the redesign was launched the  user ratings improved by +29% (from 3.47 to 4.5)

Besides that Christoph also helped the iOS engineering team and developed two features and fixed several bugs for the Grammofy application
profile_positions.title: Android Software Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Christoph has been working on the native MeeDoc mobile apps (Android & iOS) and our Scala backend. Besides that, he has kept an eye on multiple analytics systems to keep the patients engaged and satisfied.

MeeDoc is a telemedicine platform that is currently available to patients and doctors in Finland, Norway, Sweden, Spain, UK and Ireland. With MeeDoc patients can get treated faster and from the comfort of their home. 

What MeeDoc offers: 
•  Consult a fully-licensed doctor. Average response time is less than 15 minutes.
•  Send messages and upload photos. Or chat by video, just ask your doctor.  
•  Manage patients health records on the go
•  Allow patients to contact a pool of doctors 24 / 7
•  Send electronic prescriptions and referrals to specialists (e.g. lab diagnostics)

Used technologies:

•  Android: Dagger 2, Retrofit 2, OKHttp, Material Design
•  iOS: AlamoFire, SocketRocket, SnapKit / Masonry
profile_positions.title: Mobile Lead

company.name: University of Applied Sciences Upper Austria

profile_positions.company: University of Applied Sciences Upper Austria
profile_positions.description:
Working on a European Union funded project to minimize the effect of traffic congestion. The aim of the project was to analyze the influence of car to car communication to avoid traffic congestion. A simulator was developed which allowed importing an Open Street Map road network. Driving trajectories for individual cars have been generated by using mobile subscription data.

Traffic jams cause a lot of waste of energy, time and money. Additionally, the environment suffers. Avoiding traffic jams is beneficial in many respects. A lot of traffic jams are caused by clearly identifiable situations (roadworks, accident,…). In order to avoid an increase in the traffic jam, the instantaneous propagation of the information is crucial. Usually, such a situation is handled by giving a call to a broadcast station. This station broadcasts the traffic jam information after a while (typically up to 30 minutes). This delay helps the traffic jam to expand (area, number of involved vehicles). Another possibility to handle such a situation is to distribute the information instantaneously via car-to-car communication. Doing so can help to avoid an expansion of the traffic jam.

Detailed achievements:
•  Generating driving trajectories for mobile subscribers
•  Assigning trajectories to cars in the simulator
•  Estimating the cell coverage area for the mobile network
•  Annotate trajectories with timing information from hand-over cell update.
profile_positions.title: Research Associate

profile_positions.description: Christoph developed during his internship an iOS application to remotely control a PVR (personal video recorder) inside a set-up-box. The application was able to start and end a recording via the internet. Additionally, it allowed changing the channel ordering of the set-up-box. The project was carried out for A1 a major telecommunications provider in Austria.
profile_positions.title: Internship iOS Developer
